comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Looks to be John Francis (Jack) Moakley, 1863-1955, Cornell's coach of track and cross country, a position he held for 50 years until his retirement in 1949. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Moakley www.cornellbigred.com/hof.aspx?hof=319&path=&kiosk= shows a drawing with similar glasses. See comments at

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of January 24, 1916 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20917F8355C1373... reports that he had signed a ten-year contract to stay at Cornell. "ITHACA, N.Y., Jan. 23. -- Cornell's track and cross-country teams are assured of ten years more coaching by Jack Moakley one of the greatest trainers in the country, as the result of an agreement just reached by Moakley and the Cornell Athletic Association. It was announced tonight that Moakley had signed a ten-year contract to coach the track and cross-country teams. "

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq:  Thanks for your information about Moakley.  We will add some of it to the description next time we update.
